Package net.happybrackets.core.scheduling

Interface Delay.DelayListener

Enclosing class:
Delay
public static interface Delay.DelayListener
DelayReceived interface for receiving delay complete. See delayComplete(double, Object).

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void delayComplete​(double offset, java.lang.Object param)
    Event occurs when delay is complete.

  • Method Details

    • delayComplete

      void delayComplete​(double offset, java.lang.Object param)
      Event occurs when delay is complete. Consider the following code which will create an event 100 milliseconds in the future passing the parameter object 
              Object parameter = new Object();
        new Delay(100, parameter, new Delay.DelayListener() {
         @Override
            public void delayComplete(double offset, Object param) {

            }
        });
      When the delay has completed, this function will be called with the parameter passed in at the constructor ands the amount of time off the actual time in milliseconds. If for example, the function was called 2.3 milliseconds late, the offset value would be 2.3
      The function is generally coded as a lambda, where the above code would be presented as: 
           Object parameter = new Object();
     new Delay(100, parameter, (offset, param) -> {
         // delay_offset is how far out we were from our exact delay time in ms and is a double
         // param is the parameter we passed in, which was the output pin

     });
      Parameters:
      offset - the number of milliseconds we are off the tick. Positive number is late, negative is early
      param - the parameter you want to pass back when delay completed
